article: An old woman walked around as she pushed her shopping cart full of many things. She was _ . Her hair was untidy. Her clothes were torn. And some of her teeth were missing. She _ and asked me for change. Instead of giving her change, I _ her to eat out and she _ . We went across the street to an outdoor cafe so she could watch over her cart while we had lunch. The _ was surprised when this woman appeared and did not want to serve us, _ she forced herself. We ate our lunch. She was very _ and the food disappeared almost as soon as it arrived. When we were ready to _ , I was feeling very good about myself and then she asked for a _ . It was then that I had to _ myself and all the hidden bias that I had towards this _ . She wasn't wrong, but my reluctance must have _ I held her in my arms carelessly and _ I felt shame. She thanked me for lunch and then left. I _ there for a moment and realized that I had _ to give this woman the one thing that cost _ --love. I ran after the woman and caught up with her and asked her if I could give her a _ hug and she agreed. I gave the woman the best one I've ever given anyone. "That's getting it right," she said and her big _ lit my path as we parted. The _ I learned was that if you're going to give, then give it your all and get it right the first time.
